messages.text:
OK it’s really been  a while since I’ve done any “package admin”. Now I’ve got lots of questions.
1. I’ve got a few packages under an org where all the other packages seem to have Documenter running automatically. I’d like to set that up myself on the last packages. Is there anything I need to consider in terms of what they already have set up? In terms of eg Deploy Keys.
2. Eh, are we not using Travis anymore? everybody seems to be using github workflows. How do I make that transition?

elements.text:

messages.text:
I’m trying to run cleanup on my repo as described here <https://juliadocs.github.io/Documenter.jl/stable/man/hosting/#gh-pages-Branch> (I just copied the little script there without modyfying it):
But I get the message
```Run git config user.name "Documenter.jl"
fatal: pathspec 'previews/PR68' did not match any files
Error: Process completed with exit code 128.```
here <https://github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl/runs/2020226372?check_suite_focus=true>

Anyone knows what I’m doing wrong?

elements.text: I’m trying to run cleanup on my repo as described here

(I just copied the little script there without modyfying it):
But I get the message

Run git config user.name "Documenter.jl"
fatal: pathspec 'previews/PR68' did not match any files
Error: Process completed with exit code 128.
here
Anyone knows what I’m doing wrong?

messages.text: Maybe that PR didn’t have previews deployed? I think the script assumes all PRs do (but you can just ignore the error if it’s expected)

elements.text: Maybe that PR didn’t have previews deployed? I think the script assumes all PRs do (but you can just ignore the error if it’s expected)

messages.text: Ref <https://github.com/JuliaDocs/Documenter.jl/issues/1499|https://github.com/JuliaDocs/Documenter.jl/issues/1499>

elements.text: Ref
https://github.com/JuliaDocs/Documenter.jl/issues/1499

messages.text:
Could be, but I do have this in make.jl
```deploydocs(
    repo = "<http://github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl.git|github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl.git>",
    push_preview = true
)```
isn’t that supposed to deploy a preview?

elements.text: Could be, but I do have this in make.jl

deploydocs(
    repo = "github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl.git",
    push_preview = true
)
isn’t that supposed to deploy a preview?

messages.text: Yeah, but maybe that failed for some reason?

elements.text: Yeah, but maybe that failed for some reason?

messages.text: yeah maybe? I wonder how I could find it - as I know the deploydocs function is working and running

elements.text: yeah maybe? I wonder how I could find it - as I know the deploydocs function is working and running

messages.text: hm, it’s strange because the PR68 directory is in the gh-pages branch of the repo: <https://github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl/tree/08159e4e6bf0e4fec87f3b0f864301c2b86b6c83/previews/PR68>. So I’m not sure why the cleanup script couldn’t find it.

elements.text: hm, it’s strange because the PR68 directory is in the gh-pages branch of the repo:
. So I’m not sure why the cleanup script couldn’t find it.

messages.text: :exploding_head:

Well, here <https://github.com/EcoJulia/SpatialEcology.jl/pull/68/checks?check_run_id=2020225796#step:6:90> you see that the commit to gh-pages has worked (i.e. pushing the preview) and it also exists <https://ecojulia.github.io/SpatialEcology.jl/previews/PR68/> – so what are you looking for?

elements.text: Well, here
you see that the commit to gh-pages has worked (i.e. pushing the preview) and it also exists
– so what are you looking for?

messages.text: I for example to not understand your Docs cleanup

elements.text: I for example to not understand your Docs cleanup

messages.text: it seems you directly try to delete the PR-preview again with the cleanup? Then you can just not activate push-preview?

elements.text: it seems you directly try to delete the PR-preview again with the cleanup? Then you can just not activate push-preview?

messages.text: The reason your Docs cleanup might fail is – if both documenter and cleanup run in parallel and documenter has not yet pushed to GH-pages, then of cpourse cleanup can not clean anything up.

elements.text: The reason your Docs cleanup might fail is – if both documenter and cleanup run in parallel and documenter has not yet pushed to GH-pages, then of cpourse cleanup can not clean anything up.

messages.text: (and surely rendering Docs is slower than just 3 bash commands from cleanup).

elements.text: (and surely rendering Docs is slower than just 3 bash commands from cleanup).

messages.text: the docs cleanup script is supposed to run when the pull request is closed, and the preview runs when the PR is opened or updated

elements.text: the docs cleanup script is supposed to run when the pull request is closed, and the preview runs when the PR is opened or updated

messages.text: ah, so maybe I merged too quickly? Let me try a slower test

elements.text: ah, so maybe I merged too quickly? Let me try a slower test

messages.text: ah, sorry, I missed to check he triggers. That's a neat idea to delete the preview on merge.

elements.text: ah, sorry, I missed to check he triggers. That's a neat idea to delete the preview on merge.

messages.text: I think I might “steal” this script :wink: (though one also has to manually delete the other older PRs previews, too).

messages.text: And in fact, the issue was that I had merged my test PRs before the documentation finished building

messages.text: The ecojulia org has it’s own homepage (<http://ecojulia.org|ecojulia.org>) built with Franklin from this repository <https://github.com/EcoJulia/EcoJulia.org> . Now all of the packages under the org have docs built with Documenter, which puts them at e.g. <https://ecojulia.github.io/SimpleSDMLayers.jl/stable/> , though we’d like them to be at <https://ecojulia.org/SimpleSDMLayers.jl/stable/> . The synonymisation inside github (repo settings) seems not to work, at least it errors. Anyone knows how to do this?

messages.text: I'm running into a similar issue where the docs just fail to deploy both for tags and for `dev` . The documenter workflow and `make.jl`files are nearly complete copy-paste from working projects, `DOCUMENTER_KEY` exists and preview builds work. But it looks like the the actual builds on master for `dev` simply don't make it back to github - looking at `gh-pages`, I can see PR previews, but nothing from any of the pushes to `master` nor tags.
